overview: Cindy was asleep under a maple tree/ Rolled over and said to me/ I dreamt of Air Cries/ I turned over, we were lying on the the/ dry cracked mud of a river bed/ Empty Water/ Puppies, Air Cries Only/ They donâ€™t make a sound/ My eyes on fire with nothing/ to quell them/ A piece of steel in the heart/.
title: Misery Loves Company
